channel.title: Wilderness 474 Compiling help
channel.description:
Im trying to code the Wilderness 474 Client, but it wont let me. this message pops up, any ideas?! [code]'javac' is not recognized as an internal or external command, operable program or batch file. Press any key to continue . . .[/code]
when i edit my compiler, this is what it looks like. [code]@echo off @title Compile cd ../src javac -cp . -d ../build/ ./*.java pause exit[/code]

item.title: Wilderness 474 Compiling help
item.dc:creator: @teh_war_of_noobs teh war of noobs
item.description:
@teh_war_of_noobs wrote:

well i put this in:

@echo off cd..\src "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_16\bin\javac.exe" *.java pause

cause thats where all the files are, but no luck IT WORKED FOR MY SOURCE THOUGH

Read full topic

item.title: Wilderness 474 Compiling help
item.dc:creator: @Liquid_Magic Liquid Magic
item.description:
@Liquid_Magic wrote:

teh war of noobs:

well, now it says Press any key to continue . . . but nothing is changed!!

Make sure CD is pointing to the right folder. If all source files are in the same folder, just remove that line of code.

Edit:

Also make sure you saved ;0

Read full topic

item.title: Wilderness 474 Compiling help
item.dc:creator: @Liquid_Magic Liquid Magic
item.description:
@Liquid_Magic wrote:

Oh lordâ€¦

@echo off
cd SOURCEBINHERE
"C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_22\bin\javac.exe" *.java
pause

Replace

cd SOURCEBINHERE

with whatever the directory that holds the shit is called
and replace

jdk1.6.0_22\

with whatever your version of java is

Read full topic
